A 74-year-old woman slipped while mopping the kitchen floor, fell, and sustained a hip fracture. The hip fracture was treated with open reduction and internal fixation (ORIF). Name 2 risk factors for this diagnosis.
answer: Aging, menopause, long term steroid use, female gender, low estrogen or testosterone, hyperthyroidism and hyperparathyroidism, low calcium diet, low vitamin D, sedentary lifestyle, anorexia nervosa, Kidney or liver disease, rheumatoid arthritis, certain cancers (e.g., multiple myeloma)

question: A 74-year-old woman slipped while mopping the kitchen floor, fell, and sustained a hip fracture. The hip fracture was treated with open reduction and internal fixation (ORIF). State 2 other tests to confirm diagnosis
answer: Dual energy X-ray absorptiometry (DEXA) scan, markers of bone turnover e.g. P1NP and C-telopeptides, Calcium and Vitamin D levels, Thyroid function tests, Hormone levels (e.g., testosterone in men)

question: A 74-year-old woman slipped while mopping the kitchen floor, fell, and sustained a hip fracture. The hip fracture was treated with open reduction and internal fixation (ORIF). Explain the pathophysiologic classification of oedema
answer: Increased hydrostatic pressure (heart failure, venous blockage) Reduced oncotic pressure (hypoalbuminemia) Inflammation with increased capillary leakage Lymphatic obstruction Water retention (sodium and water imbalances)

Answer:  1) Thoraco-omphalopagus (joined at thorax and abdomen) 28% 2) Thoracopagus (joined at the thorax) 18.5% 3) Omphalopagus (joined at the abdomen) 10% 4) Heteropagus (parasitic twins) 10% 5) Craniopagus (joined at the level of the cranium) 6%
answer: 1. Thoraco-omphalopagus (joined at thorax and abdomen) 28% 2. Thoracopagus (joined at the thorax) 18.5% 3. Omphalopagus (joined at the abdomen) 10% 4. Heteropagus (parasitic twins) 10% 5. Craniopagus (joined at the level of the cranium) 6%

Pain relief using opoids [i.m. pethidine 50 – 100mg 6hrly]  a. Post expulsion  b. Counsel and provide emotional support  c. Oral antibiotics  d. Amoxiclav 1g 12hrly x 5 -7 days  e. Metronidazole 400mg 8 - 12hrly x 5 – 7 days  f. Analgesia  g. Suppository diclofenac 100mg bd x 5  h. Oral paracetamol 1g tds x 5  i. Oral folic acid 5mg dly
